page.title: 15FARMING -HOUGHTON ESTATE
page.content: Approximately one third of this area is farmed by a tenant farmer.Most of the land is used for arable crops including wheat, barley, rye, sugar beet, grass, carrots and potatoes.At the present time there are also 4O cattle, but this varies from time to time. Five men are employed using tractors, ploughs, cultivators, harrows, rolls, corn drills, hoes, sprayers, and sugar beet drills.At harvest time combine harvesters, balers and fork lift loaders are used.Some chemicals are used- in Autumn a pre-emergent herbicide against weeds, and in Spring a post emergent hormone weedkiller, and some fungicides.Very occasionally aerial spraying of chemicals is undertaken, but only if the ground is too wet. The soil is a mixture of sand on chalk and sandy loam on chalk.
